keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By JUSTIN GILLIS and CORAL DAVENPORT
byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta and Ellen Barry contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Unless countries develop more ambitious plans, they say, the world could suffer profound consequences, including debilitating heat waves, food shortages and fast-rising seas.

headline.print_headline: Leaders Meet to Sign a Climate Pact Fraught With Uncertainties
headline.main: Leaders Roll Up Sleeves on Climate, but Experts Say Plans Don’t Pack a Wallop

snippet: Unless countries develop more ambitious plans, they say, the world could suffer profound consequences, including debilitating heat waves, food shortages and fast-rising seas.
abstract: Global leaders prepare to meet at United Nations for ceremonial signing of Paris climate agreement, which was forged in atmosphere of seriousness and optimism but has since been dogged by significant doubts.
